{"step_by_step_thinking": "The yellowish white soft sticky deposit loosely adherent present on tooth surface is most likely plaque. Plaque is a biofilm that forms on the teeth and consists of bacteria, saliva, and food particles. It is usually yellowish or white in color and can be easily removed by brushing and flossing. Materia alba refers to a soft, white debris that can accumulate on the teeth and is easily removed by rinsing or brushing. Food debris refers to small particles of food that can get stuck between the teeth and can be removed by brushing or flossing. Calculus, also known as tartar, is a hard, calcified deposit that forms on the teeth and cannot be removed by brushing or flossing.", "answer_choice": "C. Plaque"}
